etymology.description: semantic: 牛 (ox) + phonetic: 寺 — large bull.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the bovine semantic component 牛 with 寺 providing the sound. The original sense referred to a large or notable bull, which later extended metaphorically to meanings like “special” and appears in compounds such as 特别 and 特快.

examples.chinese: 这趟特快列车今晚到达(這趟特快列車今晚到達)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tàng tèkuài lièchē jīn wǎn dàodá.

examples.chinese: 他对我有特别的关心(他對我有特別的關心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì wǒ yǒu tèbié de guānxīn.
examples.english: He has special concern for me.

examples.chinese: 我们为她准备了一份特制的礼物(我們為她準備了一份特製的禮物)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen wèi tā zhǔnbèi le yí fèn tèzhì de lǐwù.
examples.english: We prepared a custom-made gift for her.
